00037 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00038 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00039 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00040    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00041    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept them, but uses a dedicated
00042    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00043 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00044 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00045 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00046 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00048 #define XNARCH_THREAD_STACKSZ 4096

00050 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00051 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00052 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00053 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00055 #define xnarch_alloc_stack xnmalloc
00056 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree

00058 struct xnthread;
00059 struct task_struct;
00060 
00061 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00062 
00063     /* Kernel mode side */
00064     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00065     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00066     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00067     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00068     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00069 
00070     /* User mode side */
00071     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00072     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00073 
00074     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00075     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00076     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00077 
00078 } xnarchtcb_t;
00079 
00080 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00081 
00082     unsigned vector;
00083     long errcode;
00084     struct pt_regs *regs;
00085 
00086 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00087 
00088 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((fi)->vector)
00089 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->errcode)
00090 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->eip)
00091 /* fault is caused by use FPU while FPU disabled. */
00092 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  ((fi)->vector == 7)
00093 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00094    Linux stack context. */
00095 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00096                                  ((fi)->vector != 1 && (fi)->vector != 3))
00097 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->vector == 14)

00103 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00104 
00105 {
00106     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00107         return vmalloc(bytes);
00108 
00109     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00110 }
00111 
00112 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00113 
00114 {
00115     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00116         vfree(chunk);
00117     else
00118         kfree(chunk);
00119 }
00120 
00121 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00122 {
00123     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00124 }
00125 
00126 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00127 
00128 {
00129     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00130 }

00138 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00139                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00140     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);

00143 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00144 
00145 {
00146     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00147 
00148     rthal_load_cpuid();
00149 
00150     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00151        and always inside a critical section. */
00152     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00153     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00154     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00155     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00156     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00157 }
00158 
00159 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00160 {
00161     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00162 }
00163 
00164 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00165                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00166                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00167                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00168                                     )
00169 {
00170 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00171 
00172     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00173         "pushfl\n\t" \
00174         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00175         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00176         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00177         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00178         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00179         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00180         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00181         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00182         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00183         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00184         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00185         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00186         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00187         "ret\n\t" \
00188 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00189         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00190         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00191         "popfl\n\t" \
00192       : /* no output */ \
00193       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00194         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00195         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00196         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00197         "b" (out_tcb), \
00198         "S" (in_tcb), \
00199         "a" (outproc), \
00200         "d" (inproc));
00201 
00202 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00203 
00204     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00205     
00206     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00207         "pushfl\n\t" \
00208         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00209         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00210         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00211         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00212         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00213         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00214         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00215         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00216         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00217         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00218         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00219         "ret\n\t" \
00220 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00221         "popfl\n\t" \
00222       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00223         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00224         "=S" (esi_out), \
00225         "=D" (edi_out), \
00226         "+a" (outproc), \
00227         "+d" (inproc) \
00228       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00229         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00230         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00231         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00232 
00233 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00234 }
00235 
00236 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00237                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00238 {
00239     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00240     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00241     unsigned long fs, gs;
00242 
00243     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00244         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00245            clear the ts bit. */
00246         clts();
00247     
00248     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00249 
00250     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00251         {
00252         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00253 
00254         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00255 
00256         if (!inproc->mm)
00257             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00258         }
00259 
00260     if (out_tcb->user_task) {
00261        /* Make sure that __switch_to() will always reload the correct
00262           %fs and %gs registers, even if we happen to migrate the task
00263           across domains in the meantime. */
00264         asm volatile("mov %%fs,%0":"=m" (fs));
00265         asm volatile("mov %%gs,%0":"=m" (gs));
00266     }
00267 
00268     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00269 
00270     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00271 
00272         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00273 
00274         loadsegment(fs, fs);
00275         loadsegment(gs, gs);
00276 
00277         barrier();
00278 
00279         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00280            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00281            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00282            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00283            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00284            raw I/O ops. */
00285 
00286         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00287             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, adeos_processor_id());
00288 
00289             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00290                 
00291                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00292 
00293                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00294                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00295                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00296                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00297 
00298                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00299                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00300             }
00301         }
00302     }
00303 
00304     stts();
00305 }
00306 
00307 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00308                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00309 {
00310     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00311 }
00312 
00313 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00314 {
00315     /* Empty */
00316 }
00317 
00318 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00319                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00320                                          const char *name)
00321 {
00322     tcb->user_task = current;
00323     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00324     tcb->esp = 0;
00325     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00326     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00327     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00328 }
00329 
00330 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00331                                                int imask,
00332                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00333                                                void *cookie)
00334 {
00335     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00336     stts();
00337     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00338     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00339     entry(cookie);
00340     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00341 }
00342 
00343 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00344                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00345                                        void *cookie,
00346                                        int imask,
00347                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00348                                        char *name)
00349 {
00350     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00351 
00352     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00353     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00354     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00355     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00356     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00357     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00358     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00359     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00360     *--(*psp) = 0;
00361 }
00362 
00363 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00364 
00365 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00366 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   ((task)->used_math)
00367 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) ((task)->used_math = 1)
00368 #else
00369 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   tsk_used_math(task)
00370 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) set_stopped_child_used_math(task)
00371 #endif
00372 
00373 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00374 
00375 {
00376     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00377     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00378        task. */
00379 
00380     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00381 
00382     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00383         {
00384         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00385         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00386         }
00387 
00388     if(task)
00389         {
00390         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: tell Linux that this thread
00391           initialized its FPU hardware. The TS_USEDFPU bit is necessary for
00392           xnarch_save_fpu to save the FPU state at next switch. */
00393         xnarch_set_fpu_init(task);
00394         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00395         }   
00396 }
00397 
00398 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00399 
00400 {
00401     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00402     
00403     if(task)
00404         {
00405         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00406             return;
00407 
00408         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00409            of this task. */
00410         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00411         }
00412 
00413     clts();
00414     
00415     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00416         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00417     else
00418         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00419 }
00420 
00421 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00422 
00423 {
00424     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00425 
00426     if (task)
00427         {
00428         if (!xnarch_fpu_init_p(task))
00429             {
00430             stts();
00431             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00432             }
00433 
00434         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00435            hardware. */
00436         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00437         }
00438 
00439     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00440        user-space or kernel thread. */
00441     clts();
00442 
00443     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00444         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00445     else
00446         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00447 }
00448 
00449 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00450 
00451 {
00452     clts();
00453 
00454     if(!cpu_has_fxsr && tcb->user_task)
00455     /* fnsave also initializes the FPU state, so that on cpus prior to PII
00456        (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved state. */
00457         xnarch_restore_fpu(tcb);
00458 }
00459 
00460 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00461 
00462 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00463 
00464 {}
00465 
00466 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00467 
00468 {}
00469 
00470 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00471 
00472 {}
00473 
00474 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00475 
00476 {}
00477 
00478 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00479 
00480 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00484 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00485 {
00486     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00487     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00488     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00489     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00490     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00491     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00492 }
00493 
00494 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */

00496 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00497 
00498 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00499                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00500                                            const char *name)
00501 {
00502     struct task_struct *task = current;
00503 
00504     tcb->user_task = task;
00505     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00506     tcb->esp = 0;
00507     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00508     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00509     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00510 }
00511 
00512 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00513 
00514 {
00515     unsigned irq;
00516 
00517     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00518         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00519                              irq,
00520                              handler,
00521                              NULL,
00522                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00523 }
00524 
00525 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00526 
00527 {
00528     unsigned irq;
00529 
00530     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00531         {
00532         switch (irq)
00533             {
00534 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00535             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00536             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00537             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00538             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00539 
00540                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00541                 continue;
00542 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00543 
00544             default:
00545 
00546                 rthal_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00547             }
00548         }
00549 }
00550 
00551 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00552 
00553 {
00554     unsigned irq;
00555 
00556     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00557         {
00558         switch (irq)
00559             {
00560 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00561             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00562             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00563             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00564             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00565 
00566                 continue;
00567 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00568 
00569             default:
00570 
00571                 rthal_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00572             }
00573         }
00574 }
00575 
00576 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00577 
00578 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00579 
00580 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay)
00581 {
00582     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00583        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00584        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00585        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00586     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00587 }
00588 
00589 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void)
00590 {
00591     rthal_timer_release();
00592 }
00593 
00594 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00595 {
00596 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00597     return rthal_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00598 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00599     return 0;
00600 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00601 }

00603 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */

00605 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00606 
00607 #include <linux/init.h>
00608 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00609 
00610 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00611 
00612 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00613 
00614 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00615 
00616 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00617 
00618 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00619 
00620 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00621 
00622 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00623 {
00624     struct pt_regs *regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00625     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00626 
00627     fltinfo.vector = event;
00628     fltinfo.errcode = regs->orig_eax;
00629     fltinfo.regs = regs;
00630 
00631     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00632 }
00633 
00634 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00635 
00636 {
00637 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00638     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00639 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00640     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00641        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00642        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00643        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00644        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00645        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00646     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00647 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00648 }
00649 
00650 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00651 
00652 {
00653     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00654 
00655     if (!nktimerlat)
00656         return -ENODEV;
00657 
00658     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00659 
00660     return 0;
00661 }
00662 
00663 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00664 
00665 {
00666     int err;
00667 
00668 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00669     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00670        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00671     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00672 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00673 
00674     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00675 
00676     if (err)
00677         return err;
00678 
00679     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00680 
00681     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00682         return -ENOSYS;
00683 
00684     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00685                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00686                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00687                          NULL,
00688                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00689 
00690     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00691 
00692 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00693     err = xnshadow_mount();
00694 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00695 
00696     if (err)
00697         {
00698         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00699         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00700         }
00701 
00702     return err;
00703 }
00704 
00705 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00706 
00707 {
00708 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00709     xnshadow_cleanup();
00710 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00711     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00712     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00713 }
00714 
00715 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00716 
00717 #ifdef __cplusplus
00718 }
00719 #endif
00720 
00721 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */

00723 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00724 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
00725 
00726 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00727 
00728 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSTEM_H */
